INCORPORATED BY REFERENCE</font></div>

      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Portions 
of the proxy statement related to the registrant&#8217;s 2009 Annual Meeting of 
Stockholders are incorporated by reference into Part III of this 
report.</font></div><br>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">

                </td>
                <td align="left" valign="top" width="47%">      
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Principal 
      Accountant Fees and Services</font></div>
                </td>
                <td align="right" valign="top" width="7%">      
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">39</font></div>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr bgcolor="white">
                <td valign="top" width="10%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160; 
      </font></td>
                <td valign="top" width="47%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160; 
      </font></td>
                <td valign="top" width="7%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160; 
      </font></td>
              </tr>
              <tr bgcolor="#cceeff">
                <td valign="top" width="10%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160; 
      </font></td>
                <td align="left" valign="top" width="47%">      
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Part 
      IV</font></div>
                </td>
                <td valign="top" width="7%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160; 
      </font></td>
              </tr>
              <tr bgcolor="white">
                <td align="left" valign="top" width="10%">      
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline">Item 15.</font></font></div>
                </td>
                <td align="left" valign="top" width="47%">      
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Exhibits 
      and Financial Statement Schedules</font></div>
                </td>
                <td align="right" valign="top" width="7%">      
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">39</font></div>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr bgcolor="#cceeff">
                <td valign="top" width="10%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160; 
      </font></td>
                <td valign="top" width="47%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160; 
      </font></td>
                <td valign="top" width="7%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160; 
      </font></td>
              </tr>
              <tr bgcolor="white">
                <td align="left" colspan="2" valign="top" width="57%">      
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Signatures</font></div>
                </td>
                <td align="right" valign="top" width="7%">      
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">40</font></div>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr bgcolor="#cceeff">
                <td align="left" colspan="2" valign="top" width="57%">      
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Index 
      to Financial Statements</font></div>
                </td>
                <td align="right" valign="top" width="7%">      
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">F-1</font></div>
                </td>

        </div>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div><br>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; 
</font></div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; 
</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; 
</font></div>
        </div>
      </div><br>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NORTHERN 
OIL AND GAS, INC.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">2008 
ANNUAL REPORT ON FORM 10-K</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">PART 
I</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Item 
1.&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Business</font></font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Overview</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Northern 
Oil and Gas, Inc. (the &#8220;Company,&#8221; &#8220;we,&#8221; &#8220;us,&#8221; &#8220;our&#8221; and words of similar import) 
is a growth-oriented independent energy company engaged in the acquisition, 
exploration, exploitation and development of oil and natural gas 
properties.&#160;&#160;Prior to March 20, 2007, our name was &#8220;Kentex Petroleum, 
Inc.,&#8221; a Nevada corporation incorporated on October 5, 2006.&#160;&#160;The 
Company took its present form on March 20, 2007, when Northern Oil and Gas, 
Inc.&#160;&#160;(&#8220;Northern&#8221;), a Nevada corporation engaged in the Company&#8217;s 
current business, merged with and into our subsidiary, with Northern remaining 
as the surviving corporation (as more fully discussed 
below).&#160;&#160;Northern then merged into us, and we were the surviving 
corporation.&#160;&#160;We then changed our name to Northern Oil and Gas, 
Inc.&#160;&#160;References made herein to &#8220;Kentex&#8221; refer to the Company&#8217;s status 
and operations prior to March 20, 2007.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The 
Company was originally organized under the laws of the State of Nevada on 
February 10, 1983, principally for the purpose of engaging in any lawful 
activity.&#160;&#160;On or about January 18, 2006, Kentex received notification 
that the NASD had approved the Form 211 application for addition to the OTC 
Bulletin Board under the ticker symbol &#8220;KNTX&#8221;, effective January 19, 
2006.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">On March 
20, 2007, Kentex acquired Northern, pursuant to a merger by and among us, Kentex 
Acquisition Corp., a Nevada corporation and our wholly owned subsidiary (the 
&#8220;Merger Sub&#8221;), and Northern.&#160;&#160;Kentex Acquisition Corp. merged with and 
into Northern, with Northern as the surviving corporation (the 
&#8220;Merger&#8221;).&#160;&#160;We issued 21,173,013 shares of our common stock in 
exchange for 100% of the outstanding shares of Northern.&#160;&#160;Upon closing 
of the Merger, the former stockholders of Northern thereafter controlled 
approximately 94% of our outstanding shares of common 
stock.&#160;&#160;Immediately following the Merger, the Company completed a 
so-called short-form Merger with Northern, in which Northern merged into the 
Company, and the Company was the surviving entity.&#160;&#160;As a part of this 
short-form Merger, the Company changed its name to &#8220;Northern Oil and Gas, 
Inc&#8221;.&#160;&#160;As a result of the Merger, Northern was deemed to be the 
acquiring company for financial reporting purposes and the transaction has been 
accounted for as a reverse merger.&#160;&#160;The financial statements presented 
in the Company&#8217;s December 31, 2006, Form 10-KSB report were the historical 
financial statements of Kentex Petroleum, Inc, the predecessor 
company.&#160;&#160;Additional material terms of the Merger are detailed in the 
Company&#8217;s Current Report on Form 8-K filed with the Securities and Exchange 
Commission (the &#8220;SEC&#8221;) on December 19, 2006.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">On March 
17, 2008 the Company received an approval letter to begin trading on the 
American Stock Exchange (the &#8220;AMEX&#8221;).&#160;&#160;Our common stock commenced 
trading on the AMEX on March 26, 2008 under the symbol &#8220;NOG.&#8221;</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Following 
the Merger, our main business focus has been directed to oil and gas exploration 
and development.&#160;&#160;Unless specifically stated otherwise, our primary 
operations are now those formerly operated by Northern as well as other business 
activities since March, 2007.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Business</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">We are a 
growth-oriented independent energy company engaged in the acquisition, 
exploration, exploitation and development of oil and natural gas properties, and 
have focused our activities primarily on projects based in the Rocky Mountain 
Region of the United States, specifically the Williston Basin.&#160;&#160;We 
believe that we are able to create value via strategic acreage acquisitions and 
convert that value or portion thereof into production by utilizing experienced 
industry partners specializing in the specific areas of interest.&#160;&#160;We 
have targeted specific prospects and began drilling for oil in the Williston 
Basin region in the fourth fiscal quarter of 2007.&#160;&#160;As of 
March</font></div><br>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; 
</font></div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">2</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; 
</font></div>
        </div>
      </div><br>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">16, 2009, 
we had completed 46 successful discoveries, consisting of 43 targeting the 
Bakken/Three Forks formation and three targeting a Red River 
Structure.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">As an 
exploration company, our business strategy is to identify and exploit resources 
that can be quickly developed and put in production at low cost and are both 
repeatable and scalable.&#160;&#160;We also intend to take advantage of our 
expertise in aggressive land acquisition to develop exploratory projects with 
extremely attractive growth potential in focus areas and to participate with 
other companies in those areas to explore for oil and natural gas using 
state-of-the-art three-dimensional (3-D) seismic technology.&#160;&#160;We 
believe our competitive advantage lies in our ability to acquire property in the 
most exciting new plays in a nimble and efficient fashion.&#160;&#160;We are 
focused on low overhead.&#160;&#160;We believe we are in a position to most 
efficiently exploit and identify high production oil and gas 
properties.&#160;&#160;We intend to continue to carefully pursue the acquisition 
of properties that fit our profile.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Because 
we did not commence drilling activities until the fourth fiscal quarter of 2007, 
we did not perform any reservoir engineering calculations in the 2007 fiscal 
year.&#160;&#160;Although we began oil production in the fourth fiscal quarter 
of 2007, we did not receive payment or recognize revenue from sales in the 2007 
fiscal year.&#160;&#160;As such, we first began to recognize revenue from our 
oil and gas operations in 2008.&#160; <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">As such, 
many metrics of comparison from 2007 to 2008 are not 
applicable.</font><br></font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Reserves</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">We 
completed our initial reservoir engineering calculations in the first fiscal 
quarter of 2008 and completed our most recent reservoir engineering calculation 
in February 2009.&#160;&#160;Our year end calculations take into consideration 
the development of approximately 1.5% of our total drillable acreage inventory. 
The table below summarizes our estimated proved reserves by core area as of 
December 31, 2008, and our December 2008 average daily 
production.&#160;&#160;The value of our reserves is calculated by determining 
the present value of estimated future revenues to be generated from the 
production of proved reserves calculated in accordance with SEC guidelines, net 
of estimated lease operating expenses, production taxes and future development 
costs.&#160;&#160;In accordance with SEC regulations, our reserve report values 
our production based upon the $38.60 price of oil on December 31, 
2008.&#160;&#160;Oil prices have increased and we have added significant 
production since December 31, 2008.&#160;&#160;The table below uses price and 
costs without future escalation, without giving effect to non-property related 
expenses such as general and administrative expenses, debt service and 
depreciation, depletion and amortization, or Federal income taxes, and 
discounted using an annual discount rate of 10%.&#160;&#160;The values below are 
generally referred to in our industry as the &#8220;Pre-tax PV10%&#8221; values of our 
reserves and may be considered a non-GAAP financial measure as defined by the 
SEC.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Proved 
Reserves<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">(1)</font></font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div>
        <div align="left">
          <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
              <tr>
                <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="13%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">      
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Core 
      Area</font></div>
                </td>
                <td valign="bottom" width="2%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160; 
      </font></td>
                <td colspan="2" valign="bottom" width="11%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">      
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Oil</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">(2) 
      </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></font></div>
                </td>
                <td valign="bottom" width="2%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160; 
      </font></td>
                <td colspan="2" valign="bottom" width="11%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">      
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Natural Gas</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></font></div>
                </td>
                <td valign="bottom" width="2%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160; 
      </font></td>
                <td colspan="2" valign="bottom" width="11%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">      
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Total</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</font></font></div>
                </td>
                <td valign="bottom" width="2%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160; 
      </font></td>
                <td colspan="2" valign="bottom" width="13%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">      
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Pre-Tax 
      PV10% Value<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">(3)</font></font></div>
                </td>
                <td valign="bottom" width="2%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160; 
      </font></td>
                <td colspan="2" valign="bottom" width="15%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">      
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">December 
      2008 Average Daily Production</font></div>
                </td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td valign="top" width="13%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160; 
      </font></td>
                <td valign="top" width="2%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160; 
      </font></td>
                <td colspan="2" valign="top" width="11%">      
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">(<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">barrels</font>)</font></div>
                </td>
                <td valign="top" width="2%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160; 
      </font></td>
                <td colspan="2" valign="top" width="11%">      
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">(<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">cubic 
feet</font>)</font></div>
                </td>
                <td valign="top" width="2%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160; 
      </font></td>
                <td colspan="2" valign="top" width="11%">      
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">(<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">barrels of oil 
      equivalent</font>)</font></div>
                </td>
                <td valign="top" width="2%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160; 
      </font></td>
                <td colspan="2" valign="top" width="13%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160; 
      </font></td>
                <td valign="top" width="2%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160; 
      </font></td>
                <td colspan="2" valign="top" width="15%">      
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">(<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">barrels per 
      day</font>)</font></div>

      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">_____________________</font></div>
      <div>
        <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
            <tr>
              <td align="left" valign="top" width="4%">      
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">(1)</font></font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="left" valign="top" width="73%">      
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Oil 
      and gas reserve quantities and related discounted future net cash flows 
      have been derived from oil and gas prices as of December 31, 2008, 
      including the effect of dirrerentials, pursuant to current SEC and FASB 
      guidelines.</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
              <td align="left" valign="top" width="4%">      
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">(2)</font></font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="left" valign="top" width="73%">      
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Oil 
      includes natural gas liquids.</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
      <div>
        <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
            <tr>
              <td align="left" valign="top" width="4%">      
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">(3)</font></font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="top" width="73%">      
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Pre-tax 
      PV10% may be considered a non-GAAP financial measure as defined by the SEC 
      and is derived from the standardized measure of discounted future net cash 
      flows, which is the most directly comparable GAAP financial 
      measure.&#160;&#160;Pre-tax PV10% is computed on the same basis as the 
      standardized measure of discounted future net cash flows but without 
      deducting future income taxes.&#160;&#160;We believe pre-tax PV10% is a 
      useful measure for investors for evaluating the relative monetary 
      significance of our oil and natural gas properties.&#160;&#160;We further 
      believe investors may utilize our pre-tax PV10% as a basis for comparison 
      of the relative size and value of our reserves to other companies because 
      many factors that are unique to each individual company impact the amount 
      of future income taxes to be paid.&#160;&#160;Our management uses this 
      measure when assessing the potential return on investment related to our 
      oil and gas properties and acquisitions.&#160;&#160;However, pre-tax PV10% 
      is not a substitute for the standardized measure of discounted future net 
      cash flows.&#160;&#160;Our pre-tax PV10% and the standardized measure of 
      discounted future net cash flows do not purport to present the fair value 
      of our oil and natural gas 
reserves.</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The daily 
production data provided in the foregoing table does not reflect substantial 
improved production from well completions and increased flow rates on existing 
wells since December 31, 2008.&#160;&#160;We believe that production from 
existing wells in December 2008 was intentionally choked back by several 
operators in response to commodity price decreases and winter season selling 
differentials.&#160;&#160;Our average daily production as of March 13, 2009, was 
approximately 850 net barrels of oil per day, reflecting additional well 
completions and increased flow rates from pre-existing wells despite restricted 
flow rates from certain of our wells.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Our 
reserve report does not account for any value in potential reserves relating to 
any acreage not subject to drilling activities, such as our&#160;New York 
acreage and any undeveloped acreage in North Dakota or 
Montana.&#160;&#160;Further, our reserve report did not indicate any significant 
quantities of natural gas present in any wells drilling or completed as of 
December 31, 2008.&#160;&#160;We have elected not to complete an assessment of 
proven undeveloped locations (&#8220;PUD&#8217;s&#8221;) at this time due to the rapid increase in 
drilling adjacent to and in our acreage units.&#160;&#160;We intend to complete 
a reserve report including PUD&#8217;s by the end of the second quarter of 2009, at 
which time we believe we will be able to obtain a more accurate PUD&#8217;s 
estimation.&#160;&#160;Estimates of ultimate recovery from our Bakken wells have 
ranged from 350,000 to over 1,000,000 barrels of oil.&#160;&#160;Our current 
acreage position will allow us to drill up to 110 net wells based on 640-acre 
spacing units.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Recent 
Developments</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">During 
the 2008 fiscal year, we continued to focus our operations on acquiring 
leaseholds and drilling exploratory and developmental wells primarily in the 
Rocky Mountain Region of the United States.&#160;&#160;We acquired approximately 
50,000 additional net acres during 2008, primarily in Mountrail and 
Dunn&#160;Counties of North Dakota but also in Burke, Divide and other counties 
of North Dakota.&#160;&#160;As of December 31, 2008, 36 gross wells had been 
completed in which we had an interest.&#160;&#160;Our principal <font style="DISPLAY: inline">assets continue to be located in the </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">Williston</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">Basin</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline"> region of the 
northern </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">United States</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline"> and </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">Yates 
County</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">, </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">New York</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">, and 
included the following primary</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline"> positions as 
of </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">December 31, 2008:</font></font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><br></div>

        <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">
            <tr valign="top">
              <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 54pt">      
                <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#9642;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
              </td>
              <td>      
                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline">Approximately 10,000 net acres located in the 
      &#8220;Finger Lakes&#8221; region of Yates County, New York, in which we are targeting 
      natural gas production from the Trenton/Black River, Marcellus and 
      Q</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">ueenstown-Medina formations; 
      and</font></font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
        </table>
      </div><br>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; 
</font></div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">3</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; 
</font></div>
        </div>
      </div><br>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline">Approximately 5,000 net acres located in </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">McKenzie, Williams and Mercer Counties North Dakota, in 
which we are targeting the Bakken Shale.</font></font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">In 
addition to purchasing interests in oil, gas and mineral leases with the 
intention of increasing our acreage positions in desired prospects, during 
fiscal year 2008 we also utiliz</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">ed</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline"> &#8220;farm-in&#8221; 
arrangements whereby we purchase oil, gas and mineral leases under specific 
wells that are drilling or expected to drill in short order, while allowing the 
assignee of such rights to retain an overriding royalty interest </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">or a working interest that converts at pay-out 
</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">in the related 
production.&#160;&#160;Recent declines in crude oil process have made farm-in 
arrangements more cost-</font>effective to our company as an 
acquirer.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>A complete discussion of our 
significant acquisitions during the past two years is included under the heading 
&#8220;Properties &#8211; Acreage Acquisitions&#8221; in Item 2 of this report</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Production 
Methods</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>We primarily engage in oil and gas 
exploration and production through participating on a &#8220;heads-up&#8221; basis alongside 
third-party interests in wells drilled and completed in spacing units that 
include our acreage.&#160;&#160;We typically depend on drilling partners to 
propose, permit and initiate the drilling of wells.&#160;&#160;Prior to 
commencing drilling, our partners are required to provide all owners of oil, gas 
and mineral interests within the designated spacing unit the opportunity to 
participate in the drilling costs and revenues of the well to the extent of 
their pro-rata share of such interest within the spacing unit.&#160;&#160;In the 
2008 fiscal year, we participated in the drilling of all wells that included any 
of our acreage.&#160;&#160;We will assess each drilling opportunity on a 
case-by-case basis going forward and participate in wells that we expect to be 
economically feasible based upon our estimates of ultimate recoverable oil and 
gas from each project, as well as other factors.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The 
Company may utilize experienced drilling and operating partners through formal 
&#8220;farm-out&#8221; agreements in which we contribute our leasehold interests in exchange 
for working interests in wells drilled on the Company&#8217;s acreage, while a 
drilling partner funds the drilling and operation of the actual 
well.&#160;&#160;Pursuant to those arrangements, our partners will provide the 
expertise, equipment and a significant portion of the capital required to drill 
wells on our acreage.&#160;&#160;However we generally intend to participate in 
the drilling of wells including our acreage on a &#8220;heads-up&#8221; basis commensurate 
with our working interest.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">We also 
have utilized &#8220;farm-in&#8221; arrangements whereby we would purchase oil, gas and 
mineral leases under specific wells that were drilling or expected to drill in 
short order, while allowing the assignee of such rights to retain an overriding 
royalty interest in the related production.&#160;&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">In some cases t</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">hese 
farm-in arrangement</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">s</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline"> have become more cost-effective to acquire as crude oil 
prices have declined and the owners of oil, gas and mineral rights desire to 
participate in drilling wells less aggressively.&#160;&#160;Farm-in arrangements 
allow us to ensure an accelerated return on capital by deploying our acquisition 
budget to acreage that is expected to provide production in the very near 
future.</font></font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>We do not manage our commodities 
marketing activities internally, but our operating partners generally market and 
sell oil and natural gas produced from wells in which we have an 
interest.&#160;&#160;Our operating partners coordinate the transportation of our 
oil production from our wells to appropriate pipelines pursuant to arrangements 
that such partners negotiate and maintain with various parties purchasing the 
production.&#160;&#160;We understand that our partners generally sell our 
production to a variety of purchasers at prevailing market prices under 
separately negotiated short-term contracts.&#160;&#160;The price at which 
production is sold generally is tied to the spot market for crude 
oil.&#160;&#160;Williston Basin Light Sweet Crude from the Bakken source rock is 
generally 41-42 API oil and is readily accepted into the pipeline infrastructure 
at a price proximal to West Texas Immediate spot price.</font></div><br>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; 
</font></div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">4</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160; 
</font></div>
        </div>
      </div><br>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Proved 
Reserves</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Our 
estimated proved reserves as of December 31, 2008, are summarized in the table 
below based upon a reserve report prepared in February 2009 by Ryder Scott 
Company, LP.&#160;&#160;Our February 2009 reserve report did not include an 
analysis of our Proved Undeveloped Properties.</font></div>

                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 5pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">100,626</font></div>
                </td>
                <td valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160; 
      </font></td>
                <td valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160; 
      </font></td>
